ServiceCrewOwnerSharingRule.name: ServiceCrewOwnerSharingRule
ServiceCrewOwnerSharingRule.description: Represents the rules for sharing a service crew with user records other than the owner or anyone above the owner in the role hierarchy.

Description.description: A description of the sharing rule. Maximum size is 1000 characters.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Corresponds to Rule Name in the user interface. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance slows down while Salesforce generates one for each record.

GroupId.description: The ID representing the source group. A service crew owned by a User in the source Group triggers the rule to give access.

Name.description: Label of the sharing rule as it appears in the user interface. Limited to 80 characters. Corresponds to Label on the user interface.

ServiceResourceAccessLevel.description: A value that represents the type of access granted to the target Group, or UserRole. The possible values are: Read Edit All

UserOrGroupId.description: The ID representing the User or Group being granted access.
